Question: JSONObject get value of first node regardless of name: :I am wondering if there is a way to get the value of the first child of a JSONObject without knowing its name:I have some JSON coming in with a node called, this_guy{"this_guy": {"some_name_i_wont_know":"the value i care about"}}Using JSONObject, how can I get "the value i care about," cleanly if I don't know the name of the child. Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator.next
<<<explanation>>>: Iterator.next returns the next element in the iterator.

A: You can use the following code to get the value of the first child of a JSONObject without knowing its name:
JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject("{\"this_guy\": {\"some_name_i_wont_know\":\"the value i care about\"}}");
JSONObject firstChild = jsonObject.getJSONObject("this_guy");
String value = firstChild.getString("some_name_i_wont_know");

This will return the value "the value i care about".
